msContents.summary: Tax register, recording day by day the collection of money taxes.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto; Verso is blank
+ P.Cair. Inv. 57187; P.Iand. VII, 141; P.Mich. Inv. 2830; 3159; 4910

condition.ab: Regularly cut at the left and right hand sides; Kollesis left at the middle of the column. There is a damage and some lacunae at the upper part, which partly affect the text. The papyrus was folded at the Kollesis. No restoration is needed. (MA)

handDesc.p: Written in a quick but clear cursive. The scribe separated a new entry from the preceding one by underlining the name of the tax payer. (MA)

origin.origPlace: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
origin.persName: Phanomgeus, son of Petheus, grandson of Satabous, mother Tamystha (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 245)
Onnophris, son of Pasoknopaios, grandson of Petsiris, mother Heros (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 191)
Pasion, son of Petheus, grandson of Sambathion, mother Tathautis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 198)
Besis, son of Petheus, grandson of Akousilaos, mother Thermouthis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 159)
Ptolemaios, son of Naaraus the elder, grandson of Theabennis, mother Tamarres (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 217)
Onnophris, son of Onnophris, grandson of Sambas, mother Thermouthis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 191)
Neilos, son of Euhemeros, grandson of Neilos, mother Sambous (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 190)
Herakleides, son of Petheus, grandson of Heras, mother Ptolema (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 167)
Sabinus, son of Petheus, grandson of Heraklas, mother Eserempis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 222)
Ptolemaios, son of Sambas, grandson of Sabinus, mother Aphrodous (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 219)
Maron, son of Ptolemaios, grandson of Sambathion, mother Taseus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 187)
Horos, son of Petaus, grandson of Petaus, mother Tauris (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 250)
Petheus, son of Ischyrion, grandson of Pasoknopaios, mother Tephros (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 202)
Zenas, son of Phaesis, grandson of Zenas, mother Tapasion (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 250)
Horos, son of Petheus, grandson of Aunes, mother Eserempis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 250)
Longeinia Gemella (daughter of Alexander) (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 185)
Satabous, son of Petheus, grandson of Satabous, mother Tapetaus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 226)

provenance.p: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.
